intro: Fulchironia, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals, containing alkaloids such as solasodine. Fulchironia thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and potentially hazardous.
